definition: to put on a play/to perform/fig. to pretend/to feign
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: The Animal can be guilty of acting like one at time.
sentences.chinese: 动物能够成为像演戏，有时一罪。

sentences.english: Zhang Ma asked why constant agree Meng Ni and also name of acting.
sentences.chinese: 张妈便问之恒为何要同意孟妮与亦名一起演戏。

sentences.english: Did you feel like acting at that moment?
sentences.chinese: 你当时觉得你是在演戏吗？

sentences.english: He started his acting career as an extra.
sentences.chinese: 他刚开始演戏时是一个跑龙套的。

sentences.english: He dramatizes his woes with sobs and sighs.
sentences.chinese: 他像演戏似地又哭泣又叹气，来表现他的痛苦。

sentences.english: If it wasn't for acting I'd probably be a serial killer.
sentences.chinese: 如果不演戏，我想我会是一个杀人狂魔。

sentences.english: During the period of the War of Resistance Against Japan, he refused to act for the Japanese invaders.
sentences.chinese: 在抗日战争时期，他曾拒绝为日本侵略者演戏。

sentences.english: He can't afford contacts, so he acts half-blind.
sentences.chinese: 他不能戴隐形眼镜，只好半瞎着演戏。

sentences.english: If not, there must be playacting and affectation.
sentences.chinese: 一感动，就难免包含演戏和做作的成分了。

sentences.english: What do they know about theatricals?
sentences.chinese: 他们对演戏又懂得什么呢？

sentences.english: Drama is a part of life, but we don’t have to wallow in it.
sentences.chinese: 生活中总有戏剧化的一面，但是没有必要总是演戏。

sentences.english: Have you had any memorable experiences while you were acting?
sentences.chinese: 你演戏的时候有什么难忘的经历吗？

sentences.english: S: Did you feel like acting at that moment?
sentences.chinese: 你当时觉得你是在演戏吗？

sentences.english: I never know whether my wife is really crying or just playacting .
sentences.chinese: 我从来就不知道我老婆到底是真的在哭，还是在演戏。

sentences.english: This is the first time (that) I've acted on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 登台演戏我还是破题儿第一遭。

definition: to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
(of an actor) to inhabit one's role/to become the character/(of an audience) to get involved in the drama
